definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Swearing is almost a universal constant in most people’s lives.
sentences.chinese: 粗口是在大多数人的生活里几乎是普遍存在的。

sentences.english: Sometimes the coarse words are included in every sentence people say.
sentences.chinese: 有阵时，啲人每讲一句说话，都会有粗口字。

sentences.english: The documentary contains 13 expletives spoken by soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 这部记录片里有13处士兵们的粗口。

sentences.english: Which language of Foul Language will you usually use?
Previous studies have shown that letting fly with a few choice expletives can ease pain.
sentences.chinese: 先前的研究表明，偶尔爆几句粗口可以减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: He should never use vulgarisms in speech.
sentences.chinese: 他应该永远没有粗口在讲话中。

sentences.english: The boss has the right to veto the opinion and told her some bad words.
sentences.chinese: 老板有权利否决这项意见，还说了几句粗口。

sentences.english: That LSD (political party) would curse at dog-like government bureaucrats who obey whatever the Beijing government says?
sentences.chinese: 乱在社民连在议会中用粗口骂对北京唯命是从的狗官？

sentences.english: How often do you use foul languages?
The house was built under the careful supervision of an architect.
sentences.chinese: 那房女是正在一位建建师的粗口监督上建建的。

sentences.english: Why does using a swear word make us feel better?
sentences.chinese: 为什么用上粗口会让我们感觉更好？

sentences.english: Pardon my French, but he is a bloody nuisance!
sentences.chinese: 很原谅我要说粗口，但是他真的是个讨厌鬼。

sentences.english: Fisticuffs and gunplay, accompanied by swearing.
Listen carefully so as to follow the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 要粗口听才能听懂老师讲的课。

definition: to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
to shout abuses in the street
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to flip out/to act out violently
